summary: Email chain from August 28, 2019, discussing scheduling a meeting with a cooperator who has urgent information about Jeffrey Epstein. The correspondence involves Assistant United States Attorneys from the Southern District of New York coordinating availability.

events.title: Potential meeting date discussed
events.description: Email suggests September 5, 2019, as a possible date for a meeting regarding Epstein information.

events.title: Proposed meeting with cooperator
events.description: A meeting is proposed for September 9, 2019, at 12:30 PM with a cooperator who has urgent information about Epstein.

locations: NAC (likely New York Athletic Club or similar venue)
keyFacts: A cooperator with 'urgent' information about Jeffrey Epstein is being sought for a meeting by Assistant United States Attorneys.
The email chain is dated August 28, 2019, shortly after Epstein's death on August 10, 2019, indicating ongoing investigation activity.
Multiple individuals, including an attorney and an interpreter, are referenced but their names are redacted.
The correspondence involves scheduling coordination between legal officials in the Southern District of New York.
The document is part of the Epstein case files released by the Department of Justice.
